sub_title: Trade and investment commissioner at Flanders Investment & Trade and regional coordinator Northern European FIT offices
summary:
Taking your international business to new heights ~ Flemish economic Representative abroad

www.flandersinvestmentandtrade.com

Natural global - Lived and worked in 7 different countries - Loves biking, hiking, cooking and eating. Obtained a European Master’s degree (licentiaat) in applied linguistics (interpreter) at the Erasmushogeschool in Brussels in 1983, now part of VUB. He started his professional career with KBC-bank in Brussels. After that he worked as a school teacher and principal for an American school in Oviedo (Spain). In 1992 he started working as a commercial attaché for the Belgian government in Algiers and went on to become a trade commissioner for the Flemish government in respectively Tunis and Paris (France), where he became the regional coordinator for the neighboring countries. Between 2006 and 2009, he was the Trade and Investment commissioner for Flanders in Los Angeles, CA and  the regional coordinator for 'the Americas'.  In August 2009 he started working at the Embassy of Belgium in Madrid as the Trade and Investment Commissioner and in 2016 he joined the team at the Representation of the Flemish Government in The Hague in the same position.

Right now he is the Investment and Trade Commissioner and director of the London office of Flanders Investment & Trade and the regional coordinator for Northern Europe.

Specialties: Business development, trade promotion, management

Proud father of three children
